    Sina Heidari

    Virginia Tech

    • United States
    • GitHub
    • Google Scholar
    • Email

    I am a Ph.D. student at Virginia Tech working at the PEARL lab under the supervision of Prof. Dimitrios Nikolopoulos. I specialize in high-performance computing (HPC) and machine learning systems, with a background in software engineering. My research focuses on computational challenges in drug discovery.

    Recent News

    My paper, titled Heterogeneity-aware Load Balancing in Serverless Computing Environments, has been published by IEEE in 'The 7th International Conference on IoT and its Applications. Link

    My paper recieved Best Paper Award at The 7th International Conference on Internet of Things and Its Applications.

    My paper titled "Heterogeneity-aware Load Balancing in Serverless Computing Environments" authored by Sina Heidari and Sadoon Azizi has been accepted for presentation at The 7th International Conference on Internet of Things and Its Applications.
